title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 19 ยง 400.3 - Conduct of adjudicatory proceedings
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 19 ยง 400.3 - Conduct of adjudicatory proceedings

State Regulations

All adjudicatory proceedings will be conducted under the
rules enunciated by articles 3, 4 and 5 of the State Administrative Procedure

Act, the definition of the State Administrative Procedure Act pertaining
thereto, any other licensing statute under the jurisdiction of the Secretary of

State, the Civil Practice Law and Rules as the same may be reasonably be
applied and the Constitution of the State of New York as these statutes and
constitution are now stated or may be amended in the future. In all instances, due process of law will be observed. An administrative law judge shall have all
the authority which the Secretary of State may grant pursuant to the State

Administrative Procedure Act or any other pertinent statute, including, but
without limitation, the authority to direct disclosure under section 305 of the

State Administrative Procedure Act. Notes

R. & Regs. Tit. 19

400.3

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
